summary: The Delhi Sultanate , or Sulthanath-e-Hind  / Sulthanath-e-Dilli  were the Persian-speaking dynasties, of Turkic and Afghan origin, which were controlling India from 1210 to 1526. Many of these dynasties ruled from Delhi.
full_text:
The Lodi dynasty   was a Pashtun dynasty that ruled Delhi Sultanate from 1451 to 1526. It was founded by Bahlul Khan Lodi when he replaced the Sayyid dynasty and ruled the Afghan Empire in northern India.
Lodhi dynasty's reign ended under Ibrahim Lodi, who was attacked by Rana Sanga of Mewar, Lodhi's reign finally ended after he was defeated by Babur, founder of the Mughal Empire.
title: Lodi Dynasty
